title: History of Weekly ASX Small Cap Watchlists

meta.description: A historical record of the weekly ASX small cap watchlists published on this site since October 2025, including past stock codes, scores and short notes. Educational only, not financial advice.
meta.keywords: ASX small cap history, past stock picks, weekly watchlist archive, investment research log, Australian small cap stocks

hero.title: History of ASX Small Cap Picks
hero.subtitle: From October 2025 onwards - a transparent archive of previous weekly watchlists.

table.emptyState: No entries recorded for this week yet. New history will be added over time.

picks.name: Appen Limited
picks.thesis: Legacy AI data-labeling business in deep turnaround; very cheap versus its history but still facing structural demand risks, so position sizing is key.

picks.name: Tungsten Mining NL
picks.thesis: Developer of Australian tungsten assets leveraged to the critical-minerals theme, with rising volume and a break away from the $0.07–0.08 base.

picks.name: Global Lithium Resources Limited
picks.thesis: WA lithium developer with multiple projects where the share price has based out around $0.40, giving leveraged upside if lithium sentiment stabilises.

picks.name: Chariot Corporation Ltd
picks.thesis: US-focused lithium explorer with aggressive project pipeline; upside is tied to discovery success but near-term returns are highly sensitive to news flow.

picks.name: Global Lithium Resources Limited
picks.thesis: Mid-October buying around $0.45 suggests accumulation ahead of drilling and study updates, but the name still sits firmly in the high-beta resources bucket.

picks.name: Wildcat Resources Limited
picks.thesis: Pilbara lithium explorer with active drilling; price action is choppy but liquidity is strong and any material resource upgrade could be a major catalyst.

picks.name: Wildcat Resources Limited
picks.thesis: Sustained volume around $0.20–0.22 keeps it on the radar as a higher-risk lithium momentum name with meaningful upside if project quality is confirmed.

picks.name: Emyria Limited
picks.thesis: Small-cap biotech building a psychedelic-assisted therapy pipeline; late-October trading saw heavy volume, but outcomes remain binary around clinical and funding milestones.

picks.name: Ionic Rare Earths Limited
picks.thesis: Heavy rare earths developer with a pilot plant in operation; geopolitical tailwinds for non-Chinese supply chains support the long-term thesis despite short-term price weakness.

picks.name: Wildcat Resources Limited
picks.thesis: Continuing to track this lithium explorer as drilling defines the scale of the system; volatility remains high but the risk/reward at these levels is attractive for aggressive accounts.

picks.name: Botanix Pharmaceuticals
picks.thesis: Dermatology-focused biotech approaching key regulatory milestones; commercialisation execution will be the next major catalyst for a re-rate.

picks.name: Pantoro Limited
picks.thesis: Gold producer ramping up operations at Norseman; high gold prices provide a strong tailwind if operational stability can be maintained.

picks.name: Vection Technologies
picks.thesis: XR and spatial computing play with growing enterprise revenue; still speculative but the tech stack is maturing and finding real-world industrial use cases.

picks.name: Latin Resources Limited
picks.thesis: Brazilian lithium developer with a large resource base; M&A activity in the sector highlights the strategic value of hard-rock assets despite current market sentiment.

picks.name: Imugene Limited
picks.thesis: Clinical-stage immuno-oncology with a broad pipeline; news flow from multiple trials provides catalysts, though funding and clinical risk remain the primary considerations.

picks.name: Next Science Limited
picks.thesis: Medical technology company addressing biofilm-based infections; revenue growth is the key metric to watch as they scale commercial operations in the US.

picks.name: COSOL Limited
picks.thesis: Sticky, mission-critical asset-management software and services with recurring revenue across asset-intensive industries, plus bolt-on acquisitions that support steady compounding.

picks.name: Global Lithium Resources Limited
picks.thesis: Advanced multi-project lithium developer with significant WA assets offers leveraged exposure to any medium-term lithium price recovery, albeit with execution and capital-cycle risk.

picks.name: Mach7 Technologies
picks.thesis: Enterprise imaging software provider with strong recurring revenue growth and recent major contract wins. The shift to profitability lowers risk while retaining upside from global expansion.

picks.name: BluGlass Limited
picks.thesis: Unique GaN laser manufacturer transitioning from R&D to commercial production. Recent orders from tier-1 customers suggest the technology is gaining traction.

picks.name: Radiopharm Theranostics
picks.thesis: Clinical-stage radiopharmaceutical developer with a diverse pipeline and significant recent funding ($40m). High risk/reward play on targeted cancer therapies.

picks.name: COSOL Limited
picks.thesis: Profitable, dividend-paying software small cap. COSOL provides mission-critical asset management software to mining and utility giants. It offers a rare mix of defensive earnings quality and growth potential in the small-cap sector.

picks.name: Ionic Rare Earths
picks.thesis: Deep value at current levels. The Makuutu project remains a strategic geopolitical asset for heavy rare earths, and their UK magnet recycling pilot plant offers a unique, near-term commercialisation angle.

picks.name: 4DS Memory
picks.thesis: A high-risk, high-reward 'penny stock' in the semiconductor space. Their Interface Switching ReRAM technology promises immense speed and efficiency gains. It is a binary bet: if the tech is validated by partners like Western Digital, the upside is significant.

picks.name: Wildcat Resources
picks.thesis: Lithium explorer focused on the Tabba Tabba project. While the lithium sector remains volatile, aggressive drilling and potential for resource growth keep it as a high-beta play for risk-tolerant investors.

picks.name: Mach7 Technologies
picks.thesis: Enterprise imaging software provider with strong recurring revenue growth. Recent contract wins and a shift towards profitability de-risk the investment case, while global expansion offers significant upside.

picks.name: Lumos Diagnostics
picks.thesis: Point-of-care diagnostics developer (FebriDx) with growing US distribution. Regulatory approvals and commercial rollout are key catalysts, though cash burn remains a risk factor to watch.
